elements.title: chole bhature (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the origin of chole bhature (example pictured) is disputed?

elements.title: Henry I of Cyprus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that King Henry I of Cyprus is better known for having been fat than for anything he achieved in his 20-year rule?

elements.title: made from discarded rags (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that most paper in Europe was made from discarded rags until the 19th century?

elements.title: Edward Beard (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Edward Beard won reelection to the United States House of Representatives despite not winning his party's endorsement?

elements.title: Tropical Storm Pabuk (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Tropical Storm Pabuk forced PAGASA to issue cyclone advisory bulletins outside the Philippine Area of Responsibility in December 2024, for the first time since 1963?

elements.title: Muriel Hannah (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Muriel Hannah created a map that its buyer described as combining "man's greatest desires – a good looking girl on a King Crab"?

elements.title: Club Chalamet (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Club Chalamet has been described as an "integral part of Stan Twitter"?

elements.title: Helen Mulholland (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Helen Mulholland, who says her parents never drank, is the first woman master blender in the history of Irish whiskey?

elements.title: Chiisana Koi no Uta (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Chiisana Koi no Uta Band performed a cover of "Chiisana Koi no Uta" for Chiisana Koi no Uta?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

San Carlos de Bariloche

The Argentine adventure capital offers great opportunities for skiing, sightseeing, water sports, trekking and climbing amidst the amazing mountainous landscapes of Argentine Patagonia.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Andorra la Vella

Andorra la Vella is the capital of a quirky co-principality lodged in the mountains between Spain and France that offers great skiing, hiking, and lots of duty-free shopping.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

San Diego International Airport

The main airport to America's finest city is the busiest single runway airport in the world.
